intro: Beilschmiedia fagifolia, commonly known as the red-leaf beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forest environments, often reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, dark green on top, and pale underneath, with a striking reddish hue when young. Beilschmiedia fagifolia produces small, fragrant flowers followed by edible, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife.
